overview_of_class: PHYS422-1 is course 1 in the three-quarter sequence on graduate-level condensed matter physics. The course will cover the physics of electrons in metallic, insulating, and semiconducting materials. Concrete topics will include Bloch's theorem, band theory, Landau Fermi-Liquid theory, electron transport, effects of disorder, optical properties of metals, electron transport in magnetic fields and the de Haas-van Alphen effect as well as Shubnikov-de Haas oscillations.
name: Condensed-Matter Physics
